newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-ESSEX GO TO THE TOP.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ESSEX GO TO THE TOP.

text.p: Spinners Peter Such and Paul Grayson ran through Derbyshire to bowl Essex to the top of the County Championship table after an innings victory inside three days of their match at Southend.
Left-arm paceman Mark Ilott picked up two early wickets as Derbyshire chased a target of 231 to save the innings defeat after Essex reached 373 for eight shortly after lunch today.
But Such with five for 27 and Grayson with three for 20 moved in for the kill and Derbyshire were skittled for only 86, losing by an innings and 145 runs.
Australian Stuart Law and captain Paul Prichard and had earlier both completed centuries as Essex hammered home their advantage. Prichard made 106 and Law was finally dismissed for 157.

Glamorgan also earned a day off as paceman Darren Thomas claimed five for 24 in his team's 234-run victory romp over Sussex at Swansea which lifted then level on points with previous leaders Middlesex, one behind Essex.
England off-spinner Robert Croft also claimed three for nine in eight overs as the visitors were bowled out for 67 in just 32.4 overs following their first-innings total of 54 all out.
Sussex lost their last four wickets for seven runs in 19 balls as Glamorgan recorded their fourth championship win of the season.
Lancashire took three more Worcestershire wickets at New Road, reducing the home side to 100 for seven when rain finished play just before lunch.

Darren Shadford claimed his third victim when he dismissed captain Tom Moody for 26, and former England seamer Peter Martin had figures of three for 30 off 17 overs. Gavin Haynes stood firm for Worcestershire, reaching 38 not out.
